news_header: Finland's exports fell by 4% last year, with a significant decrease since 2018.
news_text: The volume of goods exported from Finland decreased by four percent last year, according to Statistics Finland. Exports have dropped nearly one quarter compared to the peak year of 2018, while imports fell by 10%. Most goods were exported by sea in containers and trucks, with oil products being the second most exported. The volume of exported pieces increased by 4%, but the volume of exported oil products decreased by 14%. Exports of sawmill products and pulp also saw a decline. Preliminary data indicates that international sea transport volume decreased by 1.5% compared to the previous year.
